channel.title: Changes to Occupation
channel.description:
I have always felt that there are too many occupy immune classes, reducing how useful Butler and Drunk are. I would like to reduce the number of occupy immune classes, and change some other things.
1. You will not be notified if your target is occupy immune. 2. The classes Hunter, Prince, Scorned, and Fool would no longer be occupy immune, and all attempted redirects would function as occupations instead. 3. Drunk, Butler, Servant, Alcoholic, Poacher, Invoker, Sorcerer, Possessor and King would be the only ones to retain full occupy and redirect immunity.
Notes: I think Mastermind doesn't need to be immune, since they still get kills and don't trigger the cool down. The Cult Leader works fine without occupy immunity. Prince would get one time occupy immunity.

item.title: Changes to Occupation
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
I think Ignition is a good ability. It would make Court Wizard less dull.

I don’t think Butler needs more powers. Servant has little need for stopping day abilities.

I personally really like Shadow Brew for Servant, as it’s a good replacement for Nightshade.

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to Occupation
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
If it doesn’t work in jail then it should also fail on scout and sacrifice btw. Invoker should have bewilder changed to the same thing.

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to Occupation
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Livicus:

Drugged Wine: (D) (4)

Choose a player. Prevent them from using Day Abilities today. Does not show message when used, but only shows that they were prevented from using a day ability when the targeted player attempts to use an ability.

Cleaner wording: Prevent the next day ability target player tries to use today.

Personally I think it SHOULD stop prince jails for the same reason as HH.

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to Occupation
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Livicus:

Ignition: (D) (2)

Choose a player. The next targeting day ability they use will target themselves. (PANTS ON FIRE)

How about the next Ability used ON target player gets redirected to the user?

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to Occupation
item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
Or we give Butler and Court Wizard day abilities to add more occupation and offense, or at least more flavor into playstyles but still completely fit the theme: (Even though Butler’s gotten two buffs which I consider quite the feat and victory for us ty devs)

Butler & Servant

Drugged Wine: (D) (4)
Choose a player. Prevent them from using Day Abilities today. Does not show message when used, but only shows that they were prevented from using a day ability when the targeted player attempts to use an ability.

Court Wizard & Sage

Ignition: (D) (2)
Choose a player. The next targeting day ability they use will target themselves. (PANTS ON FIRE)

Prince is an exception to both the abilities above, or we could make both abilities just not bypass occupy immunity for coherence.

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to Occupation
item.dc:creator: techwolves
item.description:
Marl thats actually a good idea makes up for him losing his night shade wine

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to Occupation
item.dc:creator: Marluxion
item.description:
Alternative Solution; Since Servant loses their day ability of nightshade wine, why not give them a new day ability
Shadow Brew [1-use]: Tonight, your Serve Wine will bypass Occupy Immunity and will also occupy anyone else visiting your target

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to Occupation
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
No. That would confirm the butler as converted if he happens to choose the prince ever.

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to Occupation
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
Or, just make him only immune to friendly occupation? That could be a passive wording tweak.

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to Occupation
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
That could actually work.

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to Occupation
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
Yeah, I do admit that would suck. But I would still like Servant to still be able to stop him. One solution could be to give it a one time occupation immunity (like Inquisitor with Death Immunity)

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to Occupation
item.dc:creator: Marluxion
item.description:
The case in which it is useful and intentional from the unseen/cult is an edge case, yeah. But I can guarantee you that a bd will accidentally stop an execution like 33% of games.

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to Occupation
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
A random occupy from a Butler or Drunk usually wouldn’t do anything to Prince, since they aren’t always executing. The real problem is if it was directed at the Prince by Unseen/Cult. But I feel this could apply to a lot of other BD classes. If the unseen/cult know who the Phys/Knight is, they can occupy and kill the Prince or whatever class. I also feel this is a pretty edge case, and would rarely come up. Since the Cult/Unseen need a servant/alcoholic/invoker/poacher. It would also require the Prince not be killed beforehand, which happens a lot.

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to Occupation
item.dc:creator: Marluxion
item.description:
The balance issue might not be extremely large, but the un-fun aspect definitely would be. and this is just as important for the devs to consider as balance! The prince randomly getting occupied by BD isn’t fun for anyone.

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to Occupation
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
NightX:

One thing I think should be implemented is not using charges if you are occupied. This always feels really annoying to just have my ability simply wasted.

This I agree with. However prevention should remain the same due to its trickier use and more limited appearance.

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to Occupation
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
I don’t think is a huge balance issue if Prince get occ’d. First of all, if the Prince is outed no BD will occupy them. Cult/Unseen can only take advantage of revealed Prince if they convert one of 3 classes, and they don’t get promoted.

Even if there is, a CW can counter this.

One thing I think should be implemented is not using charges if you are occupied. This always feels really annoying to just have my ability simply wasted.

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to Occupation
item.dc:creator: Marluxion
item.description:
As for the prince, he’s widely thought of as the blue dragon power class. While him being occupied is an interesting concept, this could lead to blue dragon shooting themselves in the foot in that he can waste charges of his execute when occupied randomly by a butler/drunk. The concept isn’t fun for anyone, really. It’s not fun for the prince nor is it fun for the butler/drunk.

The prince being not occupy immune would tank blue dragon’s winrate a ton unnecessarily.

A change that I DO Think should be made regarding the prince’s occ immunity though; I believe Happy Hour from Drunk and Alcoholic should stop the prince’s execute (it currently doesn’t.) Since happy hour is usually only used when a target is suspicious (due to it’s limited charges) it won’t randomly hit the prince often. But It would allow an Alcoholic to save their fellow unseen from otherwise certain death (if they can figure out who the prince is.)

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to Occupation
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Just for the record. The only situation where poacher is inherently an issue is if he targets a CW that swaps himself with the poacher.

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to Occupation
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
Poacher never crossed my mind. Thinking of it, it is absolutely necessary. I don’t think Hunter would have to retain it, since converted classes can have different abilities. I am definitely adding Poacher to the list of immune classes.

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to Occupation
item.dc:creator: Marluxion
item.description:
Still, Hunter being occupy immune in addition to Poacher gives the game consistency. Most other classes don’t go from not occupy immune to occupy immune.

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to Occupation
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Which makes Butlers and Drunks weak enough to be a negative utility. Especially butlers

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to Occupation
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
Unless, you know, occupy immune classes aren’t outed.

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to Occupation
item.dc:creator: Marluxion
item.description:
I’m not sure why no one has brought this up yet, @NightX. But the main reason Hunter is occupy immune IS for a balance reason.

The Hunter’s unseen converted form is the Poacher. The poacher is an occupier! Making the Hunter not occupy immune but the Poacher Occ Immune is a huge nerf! And if you make both not occ immune, you run into problems with occupiers occupying occupiers (the very reason butler/drunk are occ immune.)

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to Occupation
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
I’m mostly doing it because it reduces Drunk/Butler power. They are useless against Mastermind, Poacher, Scorned, and Fool.The whole point is to suppress evils.

The other ones just feel arbitrary immunity, and reduce Servant/Alcoholic/Invoker power to suppress BD. It would only be a minor nerf, and make these evil classes have more utility.

I thought Sorcerer/Possessor redirect immunity was unneeded, but I wouldn’t mind if that wasn’t removed.

Read full topic

item.title: Changes to Occupation
item.dc:creator: techwolves
item.description:
Going to appolgize for my comments got to heated over this post
